collections.title: AI Feature Productization
collections.shortDescription: Transform AI/ML prototypes into production-ready product features.
collections.description: Comprehensive guide for taking AI and machine learning capabilities from research or prototype stage to fully productized features. This playbook addresses the unique challenges of AI products including model performance metrics, bias detection, explainability, edge cases, user trust, and safe rollout strategies. Critical for PMs at AI-first companies building intelligent automation.

prompts.note: Conduct AI-specific user research to understand trust, AI literacy, and human-AI interaction patterns
Create comprehensive PRD for AI feature including model requirements and AI interaction design
Conduct thorough AI/ML risk assessment: bias, drift, hallucination, explainability, adversarial attacks
Define model performance metrics, thresholds, SLAs, and acceptance criteria
Design production-ready AI inference APIs with async patterns, confidence scores, and versioning
Design data schema for training data, predictions, feedback loops, and audit trails
Create comprehensive ML testing strategy: accuracy, bias, robustness, and production validation
Plan phased AI rollout with shadow mode, confidence ramps, and human-in-the-loop transitions

prerequisites: Working AI/ML prototype or proof of concept
Access to training data and initial model performance metrics
Alignment with ML/AI engineering team on technical feasibility
Understanding of model limitations, edge cases, and failure modes
Stakeholder buy-in for phased rollout approach
outcomes: AI-specific user research insights on trust and adoption patterns
Production-ready AI feature PRD with model requirements
Comprehensive AI/ML risk register with mitigations
Model performance metrics, thresholds, and SLAs
AI service API specification with async and streaming support
ML testing framework covering accuracy, bias, and robustness
Phased rollout plan with confidence ramps and rollback procedures

collections.title: Data-Driven Product Management
collections.shortDescription: Leverage data analysis to make better product decisions.
collections.description: A collection focused on using data to drive product decisions. Learn to analyze metrics, run experiments, and extract insights from user behavior data.

prompts.note: Define and calculate key product metrics
Prepare and clean data for analysis
Find correlations in your data
Design and analyze A/B tests
Forecast trends and outcomes
Create compelling data visualizations
Analyze sentiment in user feedback

collections.title: Enterprise Pilot to Production
collections.shortDescription: Scale a successful enterprise pilot into full production deployment.
collections.description: A systematic approach to transitioning enterprise AI/automation solutions from pilot phase to full production. Covers success criteria validation, stakeholder alignment, scaling strategy, and rollout planning. Essential for PMs managing enterprise deployments with multiple stakeholders and complex requirements.

prompts.note: Synthesize pilot feedback from all stakeholders and users
Calculate and validate pilot success metrics and ROI
Identify production scaling risks and mitigation strategies
Plan phased rollout roadmap across departments/regions
Document production architecture and scaling requirements
Create comprehensive production testing and validation plan
Execute phased production rollout

outcomes: Validated pilot success metrics and ROI documentation

collections.title: Enterprise Sales Enablement
collections.shortDescription: Create compelling sales materials for enterprise AI/automation deals.
collections.description: Equip your sales team with everything they need to close enterprise deals. This playbook helps PMs create ROI calculators, competitive battle cards, demo scripts, and objection handling guides. Essential for companies with long enterprise sales cycles and multiple stakeholder buy-in requirements.

prompts.note: Define buyer personas: economic buyer, technical buyer, end user
Create competitive analysis and battle cards
Develop pricing strategy and packaging for enterprise tiers
Build ROI calculator and value quantification framework
Generate messaging and positioning for enterprise buyers
Analyze deal patterns and create playbook for common scenarios

prerequisites: Access to win/loss data and sales feedback

collections.title: Enterprise Security & Compliance Readiness
collections.shortDescription: Prepare your product for enterprise security requirements and compliance certifications.
collections.description: Navigate the complex landscape of enterprise security requirements. This playbook helps PMs work with security teams to achieve SOC 2, GDPR, HIPAA compliance, pass security reviews, and address enterprise procurement requirements. Essential for selling AI/automation solutions to regulated industries and large enterprises.

prompts.note: Analyze target market compliance requirements (healthcare, finance, etc.)
Conduct security risk assessment and gap analysis
Prioritize security features and compliance requirements
Document security architecture and data handling practices
Plan compliance certification timeline and milestones
Create security testing and penetration testing plan
Document security features PRD (SSO, audit logs, encryption, etc.)

prerequisites: Understanding of target customer compliance requirements
Access to security and legal teams

collections.title: MVP Development
collections.shortDescription: Build a minimum viable product from concept to working prototype.
collections.description: This collection guides you through building an MVP, from defining what to build to creating working prototypes. Perfect for startups, new products, or validating ideas quickly.

prompts.note: Ruthlessly prioritize for MVP scope
Document your MVP requirements
Design your data model
Define your API structure
Build UI components
Create landing page or marketing site
Plan validation testing

collections.title: New Feature Launch Playbook
collections.shortDescription: Complete workflow from discovery to execution for launching new features.
collections.description: This collection guides you through the entire process of launching a new feature, from initial discovery and prioritization through creating documentation, building prototypes, and managing the release. Follow these prompts in order for a comprehensive feature launch process.

prompts.note: Start by evaluating and prioritizing your feature ideas
Define who you're building this feature for
Create a comprehensive Product Requirements Document
Identify and plan for potential risks
Build UI prototype components
Plan and execute the release

prerequisites: A feature idea or problem to solve
Basic understanding of your target users

collections.title: Platform Integration Strategy
collections.shortDescription: Plan and execute integrations with enterprise systems like Salesforce, SAP, and ServiceNow.
collections.description: A comprehensive approach to building enterprise integrations that drive platform adoption. Covers partner ecosystem analysis, integration architecture, API design, and go-to-market strategy for integrations. Critical for enterprise platforms that need to connect with existing customer tech stacks.

prompts.note: Analyze integration ecosystem and prioritize target platforms
Define integration user personas: admins, developers, end users
Prioritize integration features and use cases
Document integration architecture and data flow patterns
Design integration APIs and webhook specifications
Create sample integration scripts and templates
Plan integration testing across partner platforms
Develop co-marketing strategy with integration partners

prerequisites: Customer demand signals for specific integrations

collections.title: PM Beginner Toolkit
collections.shortDescription: Essential prompts for product managers just getting started.
collections.description: A curated collection of fundamental prompts that every new product manager should know. Start here to build your PM toolkit with the most commonly used and impactful prompts.

prompts.note: Learn to define and understand your users
Master the art of prioritization
Write effective product requirement documents
Analyze your competitive landscape
Plan and communicate your roadmap

prerequisites: A product or feature idea to work with

collections.title: Product Discovery Sprint
collections.shortDescription: Run a focused discovery sprint to validate ideas and define product direction.
collections.description: A structured approach to product discovery that helps you understand your market, users, and competitive landscape. Use this collection to run a focused discovery sprint before committing to building new features or products.

prompts.note: Understand the market opportunity and landscape
Analyze competitive positioning
Define and understand your target users
Synthesize user feedback and insights
Strategic analysis and recommendations
Prioritize opportunities based on findings

prerequisites: A product area or opportunity to explore
Access to market data or research

collections.title: Quick POC
collections.shortDescription: Iterate from idea to working prototype in 3-5 days.
collections.description: A fast-paced playbook for building proof-of-concept prototypes. Validate feasibility, UX, and technical approach before committing to full development. Includes PRD scoping, technical design, implementation planning, UX review, feasibility assessment, and legal/IP considerations.

prompts.note: Define POC scope: problem, goals, core features, and constraints. Keep it lean - this feeds into the tech design.
Design minimal architecture. Paste PRD summary into 'PRD or App Description' input. Focus on speed over perfection.
Generate step-by-step build plan. Paste PRD and tech design summaries as inputs. Defines what to build vs. skip.
Review the built POC against requirements. Paste PRD user stories and describe what was built. Identifies quick wins.
Assess feasibility and risks. Set stage to 'POC validation'. Paste PRD and tech summaries. Get go/no-go recommendation.
Review licensing, IP, and compliance. Paste tech stack and data sources. Identifies blockers before scaling.

prerequisites: A clear idea or problem to validate
Access to necessary APIs/services for POC

collections.title: Technical PM Essentials
collections.shortDescription: Essential prompts for technical product managers working with engineering teams.
collections.description: A collection of prompts designed for technical product managers who work closely with engineering teams. Covers technical documentation, API design, database planning, and test strategies.

prompts.note: Create technical design documents
Design and document API endpoints
Plan database schemas and data models
Generate unit test specifications
Create comprehensive test plans
Technical UX review and recommendations
